title: 3 Ways to Edit Word Documents on PC or Mac

steps.title: Click the Home tab on the top-left.
steps.content: Click the Home tab on the top-left. This button is in the upper-left corner of your document. It will open your text styling tools on the toolbar ribbon.

steps.title: Select the text you want to format.
steps.content: Select the text you want to format. You can select a word, sentence, paragraph or section in your document. If you want to select the entire document, press Control + A on Windows, or âŒ˜ Command + A on Mac.

steps.title: Click the icon next to the Font field.
steps.content: Click the icon next to the Font field. This will open a list of all your available font options.

steps.title: Select a font on the menu to apply it.
steps.content: Select a font on the menu to apply it. Clicking a font here will change the selected text to this font.

steps.title: Enter a number into the Font Size field.
steps.content: Enter a number into the Font Size field. This field shows the current size of your text next to the Font field. You can manually enter a size here, or click the icon and select a size on the menu.

steps.title: Select an alignment position for your text.
steps.content: Select an alignment position for your text. The alignment buttons look like aligned, centered, and justified paragraph icons in the middle of the Home toolbar. You can align your text left, center it, align it right, or justify it.

steps.title: Click the Line and Paragraph Spacing button.
steps.content: Click the Line and Paragraph Spacing button. This button looks like a paragraph icon with two blue arrows next to it. It will open your spacing options on a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select the spacing option you want to use.
steps.content: Select the spacing option you want to use. You can set your spacing at different common values like 1.0, 1.5, or 2.0. If you want to double-space your text, select 2.0 here.

steps.title: Open the Word document you want to edit.
steps.content: Open the Word document you want to edit. Find the document you want to edit, and double-click on its name to open the text file.

steps.title: Click the Layout tab at the top.
steps.content: Click the Layout tab at the top. This button is located above the toolbar ribbon in the upper-left corner of your document. It will open your layout tools on the toolbar ribbon.

steps.title: Click the Margins menu on the top-left.
steps.content: Click the Margins menu on the top-left. This is the first option on the Layout ribbon. It will open your document's margin options on a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select the document margin you want to use.
steps.content: Select the document margin you want to use. You can use Normal, Narrow, Moderate, Wide, or Mirrored margins. Click a margin option to see what it looks like. You can see the exact margin indent values below each option. If you don't like any of the options here, click Custom Margins at the bottom, and manually enter the margin indent values you want to use.

steps.title: Select a paragraph or section to customize the margin and spacing.
steps.content: Select a paragraph or section to customize the margin and spacing. You can manually customize the margin indent and spacing options of a paragraph or section in your text without affecting the overall margins of your document.

steps.title: Fill out the Indent and Spacing values on the toolbar.
steps.content: Fill out the Indent and Spacing values on the toolbar. You can find these sections in the middle of the Layout ribbon. Indent will allow you to customize the selected region's margins from left and right. Spacing will allow you to make the space above or below the selected region larger or smaller.

steps.title: Click the Orientation menu next to Margins.
steps.content: Click the Orientation menu next to Margins. This will open your document's page orientation options on a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select Portrait or Landscape on the menu.
steps.content: Select Portrait or Landscape on the menu. Click one of the options here to change your document's page orientation.

steps.title: Click the Size menu next to Orientation.
steps.content: Click the Size menu next to Orientation. This will open a list of available paper-size configurations you can use for your document.

steps.title: Find and select the paper size you want to use.
steps.content: Find and select the paper size you want to use. This will help you accurately preview your document's print output on the paper size you're planning to use.

steps.title: Click the Columns next to Size.
steps.content: Click the Columns next to Size. This option allows you to create multiple text columns in your text document. You can select a paragraph or section in your document and apply your columns here if you want to use different numbers of columns in different parts of your text.

steps.title: Select the number of columns you want to use.
steps.content: Select the number of columns you want to use. Click a column option on the drop-down menu to apply it to the selected part of your text. Two and Three will create multiple, equal-sized columns. Left and Right will create two columns, and make one of them wider than the other one. If you want to manually customize your column number, size, and spacing, click More Columns at the bottom.

steps.title: Click the Design tab at the top.
steps.content: Click the Design tab at the top. You can find it between Insert and Layout above the toolbar ribbon in the upper-left corner. It will open your design tools on the ribbon.

steps.title: Click the Themes button.
steps.content: Click the Themes button. This is the first option on the Design toolbar in the upper-left corner. It will open your document theme options on a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select a theme on the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select a theme on the drop-down menu. Click on a theme to see different design variations of it. When you select a theme, related design variations will be listed next to it on the Design ribbon.

steps.title: Click the Colors button.
steps.content: Click the Colors button. This button is located towards the right-hand side of the toolbar ribbon. It will open a drop-down menu of different color palettes you can use.

steps.title: Select a color palette.
steps.content: Select a color palette. Click the color palette you want to use. This will filter the themes on the toolbar ribbon, and restrict the selection to the selected color palette.

steps.title: Click the Fonts button.
steps.content: Click the Fonts button. This will open a list of all the available fonts you can use for your text.

steps.title: Select the font you want to use in your document.
steps.content: Select the font you want to use in your document. This will filter the themes on the ribbon and only show themes with your selected font.

steps.title: Click a design theme on the toolbar ribbon.
steps.content: Click a design theme on the toolbar ribbon. Find an interesting design and click on it to apply the theme to your document. Some themes will change all the heading and spacing stylings in your document whereas some others will do as little as only changing your font.
